Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7 Parole or hearing dates -- Interview -- Hearings -- Report of alienists -- Mental competency.licensed mental health professional -- Mental competency -- Rulemaking authority.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(a): For an offender serving a sentence upon conviction of a felony or class A misdemeanor offense, the board shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(a)(i): within six months after the day on which the offender is committed to the custody of the department, set a hearing date to establish the offender's release date or date for rehearing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(a)(ii): promptly notify the offender of the date described in Subsection (1)(a)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(b)(i): The board may delay setting the hearing date described in Subsection (1)(a)(i) if the offender has an additional pending criminal case at the time of the offender's commitment to the custody of the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(b)(ii): For purposes of Subsection (1)(b)(i), a pending criminal case includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(b)(ii)(A): uncharged conduct that is being screened for prosecution, unless one year has passed since the day on which the board was notified of the screening and no charge has been filed within that time period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(b)(ii)(B): charged conduct that has not reached resolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(c): If the board delays setting the hearing date as described in Subsection (1)(b), the board shall set a hearing date no later than six months after the day on which the final criminal case described in Subsection (1)(b) has been resolved.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(d)(i): If the board delays setting the hearing date as described in Subsection (1)(b), the board shall establish and use a process to monitor the progress of the pending criminal action by seeking or obtaining updates no less frequently than every six months.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(d)(ii): The board shall establish the process described in Subsection (1)(d)(i) by creating rules in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(e): When determining the hearing date under Subsection (1)(a), the board shall consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(e)(i): the type and severity of offenses;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(e)(ii): prior criminal history;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(e)(iii): criminogenic risk factors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(1)(e)(iv): evidence-based assessments.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(2)(a): Before reaching a final decision to release an offender under this chapter, the chair shall cause the offender to appear before the board, the board's panel, or an appointed hearing officer, who shall personally interview the offender to consider the offender's fitness for release and verify as far as possible information furnished from other sources.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(2)(b): An offender may waive a personal appearance before the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(2)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(2)(c)(i): An offender outside of the state shall, if ordered by the board, submit to a courtesy hearing to be held by the appropriate authority in the jurisdiction in which the offender is housed in lieu of an appearance before the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(2)(c)(ii): The offender shall be promptly notified in writing of the board's decision.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7(3): 76-5-301.1; 76-5-302; 76-5-402; 76-5-402.1; 76-5-402.2; 76-5-402.3; 76-5-403; 76-5-403.1; 76-5-404; 76-5-404.1; 76-5-404.3; 76-5-405

Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7.1 Appointment of counsel or lay representative -- Procedures.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7.1(1): If the board in the board's discretion determines that an offender within the board's jurisdiction is unable, due to physical, mental, or other circumstances, to meaningfully participate in a board hearing or other board proceeding, the board may appoint, at the board's own expense, legal counsel or a lay representative to assist the offender.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7.1(2): The board shall determine the scope of the representation described in Subsection (1) based on a review of the totality of the circumstances.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7.1(3): 77-27-7 This section does not prevent the board from:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7.1(3)(a): 77-27-7 appointing a licensed mental health professional in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-7.1(3)(b): otherwise seeking information concerning the offender from the department or another entity.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-8 Record of hearing.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-8(1): A verbatim record of proceedings before the Board of Pardons and Parole shall be maintained by a suitable electronic recording device, except when the board dispenses with a record in a particular hearing or a portion of the proceedings.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-8(2): When the hearing involves the commutation of a death sentence, a certified shorthand reporter, in addition to electronic means, shall record all proceedings except when the board dispenses with a record for the purpose of deliberations in executive session.  The compensation of the reporter shall be determined by the board.  The reporter shall immediately file with the board the original record and when requested shall with reasonable diligence furnish a transcription or copy of the record upon payment of reasonable fees as determined by the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-8(3): When an inmate or offender affirms by affidavit that he is unable to pay for a copy of the record, the board may furnish a copy of the record, at the expense of the state, to the inmate or offender.

Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5 Victim may attend hearings.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(1): As used in this section, "hearing" means a hearing for a parole grant or revocation, or a rehearing of either of these if the offender is present.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(2)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (2)(b), when a hearing is held regarding any offense committed by the defendant that involved the victim, the victim may attend the hearing to present the victim's views concerning the decisions to be made regarding the defendant.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(2)(b)(i): The victim may not attend a redetermination or special attention hearing if the offender is not present.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(2)(b)(ii): At that redetermination or special attention hearing, the board shall give consideration to any presentation previously given by the victim regarding that offender.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3)(a): The board shall send timely notice of the hearing to the victim as provided in Subsection (3)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3)(b): The notice shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3)(b)(i): the date, time, and location of the hearing;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3)(b)(ii): a clear statement of the reason for the hearing, including all offenses involved;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3)(b)(iii): the statutes and rules applicable to the victim's participation in the hearing;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3)(b)(iv): the address and telephone number of an office or person the victim may contact for further explanation of the procedure regarding victim participation in the hearing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3)(b)(v): specific information about how, when, and where the victim may obtain the results of the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3)(c): The board may notify a victim through the board's website or through the mail or other electronic means available to the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3)(d): If the victim requests that a notification occur using a specific method offered by the board, the board shall make reasonable efforts to accommodate that request.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3)(e): If the victim is deceased, or the board is otherwise unable to contact the victim, the board shall make reasonable efforts to notify the victim's immediate family of the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(3)(f): The victim may communicate with the board for consideration of continuance of the hearing if travel or other significant conflict prohibits the victim's attendance at the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(4): The victim, or family members if the victim is deceased or unable to attend due to physical incapacity, may:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(4)(a): attend the hearing to observe;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(4)(b): make a statement to the board, or the board's appointed examiner, in person or through a representative appointed by the victim or the victim's family; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(4)(c): remain present for the hearing if the victim appoints another to make a statement on the victim's behalf.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(5): The statement may be presented:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(5)(a): as a written statement, which may also be read aloud, if the presenter desires; or
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(5)(b): as an oral statement presented by the person selected under Subsection (4).
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(6): The victim may be accompanied by a member of his family or another individual, present to provide emotional support to the victim.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(7): The victim may, upon request, testify outside the presence of the defendant but a separate hearing may not be held for this purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(8)(a): If a victim does not attend a hearing, the victim may provide a written statement that complies with board rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(8)(b): If the victim does not offer a verbal or written statement at the time of the hearing, the board shall consider any statement from the victim that was previously provided to the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-9.5(8)(c): The board may not afford a written statement provided by a victim less weight than a verbal statement solely because the statement is written.

Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-10.5 Special condition of parole -- Penalty.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-10.5(1): 77-27-5 In accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-10.5(2): The order may prohibit the defendant from contracting with any person, firm, corporation, partnership, association, or other legal entity with respect to the commission and reenactment of the defendant's criminal conduct, by way of a movie, book, magazine article, tape recording, phonograph record, radio, or television presentations, live entertainment of any kind, or from the expression of the defendant's thoughts, feelings, opinions, or emotions regarding the criminal conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-10.5(3): The board may order that the prohibition includes any event undertaken and experienced by the defendant while avoiding apprehension from the authorities or while facing criminal charges.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-10.5(4): 77-27-11 The board may order that any action taken by the defendant by way of execution of power of attorney, creation of corporate entities, or other action to avoid compliance with the board's order shall be grounds for revocation of parole as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-10.5(5): Adult Probation and Parole shall notify the board of any alleged violation of the board's order under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-10.5(6): The violation of the board's order shall be considered a violation of parole.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-10.5(7): For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-10.5(7)(a): "convicted" means a conviction by entry of a plea of guilty or nolo contendere, guilty with a mental condition, no contest, and conviction of any crime or offense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-10.5(7)(b): "defendant" means the convicted defendant, the defendant's assignees, and representatives acting on the defendant's authority.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11 Revocation of parole.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(1): The board may revoke the parole of any individual who is found to have violated any condition of the individual's parole.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(2): 64-13-29
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(2)(a): If a parolee is confined by the department or any law enforcement official for a suspected violation of parole, the department:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(2)(a)(i): shall immediately report the alleged violation to the board, by means of an incident report; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(2)(a)(ii): make any recommendation regarding the incident.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(2)(b): A parolee may not be held for a period longer than 72 hours, excluding weekends and holidays, without first obtaining a warrant.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(2)(c): 64-13-29 The board shall expeditiously consider warrant requests from the department under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(3): Any member of the board may:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(3)(a): issue a warrant based upon a certified warrant request to a peace officer or other persons authorized to arrest, detain, and return to actual custody a parolee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(3)(b): upon arrest of the parolee, determine, or direct the department to determine, if there is probable cause to believe that the parolee has violated the conditions of the parolee's parole.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(4): Upon a finding of probable cause, a parolee may be further detained or imprisoned again pending a hearing by the board or the board's appointed examiner.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(a): The board or the board's appointed examiner shall conduct a hearing on the alleged violation, and the parolee shall have written notice of the time and location of the hearing, the alleged violation of parole, and a statement of the evidence against the parolee.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(b): The board or the board's appointed examiner shall provide the parolee the opportunity:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(b)(i): to be present;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(b)(ii): to be heard;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(b)(iii): to present witnesses and documentary evidence;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(b)(iv): to confront and cross-examine adverse witnesses, absent a showing of good cause for not allowing the confrontation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(b)(v): to be represented by counsel when the parolee is mentally incompetent or pleading not guilty.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(c)(i): If heard by an appointed examiner, the examiner shall make a written decision which shall include a statement of the facts relied upon by the examiner in determining the guilt or innocence of the parolee on the alleged violation and a conclusion as to whether the alleged violation occurred.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(c)(ii): The appointed examiner shall then refer the case to the board for disposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(d)(i): A final decision shall be reached by a majority vote of the sitting members of the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(5)(d)(ii): A parolee shall be promptly notified in writing of the board's findings and decision.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6): 77-32b-105; 63M-7-404; 64-13-6
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(a): 77-32b-105 If a parolee is found to have violated the terms of parole, the board, at the board's discretion, may:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(a)(i): return the parolee to parole;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(a)(ii): 77-32b-105 modify the payment schedule for the parolee's criminal accounts receivable in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(a)(iii): order the parolee to pay pecuniary damages that are proximately caused by a defendant's violation of the terms of the defendant's parole;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(a)(iv): order the parolee to be imprisoned, but not to exceed the maximum term of imprisonment for the parolee's sentence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(a)(v): order any other conditions for the parolee.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(b): If the board returns the parolee to parole, the length of parole may not be for a period of time that exceeds the length of the parolee's maximum sentence.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(c): 63M-7-404 If the board revokes parole for a violation and orders incarceration, the board may impose a period of incarceration:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(c)(i): 63M-7-404 consistent with the guidelines under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(c)(ii): subject to Subsection (6)(a)(iv), impose a period of incarceration that differs from the guidelines.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(d): 64-13-6 The following periods of time constitute service of time toward the period of incarceration imposed under Subsection (6)(c):
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(d)(i): time served in jail by a parolee awaiting a hearing or decision concerning revocation of parole; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-11(6)(d)(ii): 64-13-6 time served in jail by a parolee due to a violation of parole under Subsection

----------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13 Board of Pardons and Parole -- Duties of the judiciary, the Department of Corrections, and law enforcement -- Removal of material from files.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(1): The chief executive officer and employees of each penal or correctional institution shall cooperate fully with the board, permit board members free access to offenders, and furnish the board with pertinent information regarding an offender's physical, mental, and social history and his institutional record of behavior, discipline, work, efforts of self-improvement, and attitude toward society.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(2)(a): The department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(2)(a)(i): furnish any pertinent information , within the department's possession, to the board; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(2)(a)(ii): provide a copy of the presentence report, any available information within the department's possession concerning the impact a crime may have had upon the victim or the victim's family, and any other investigative reports to the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(2)(b): In all cases where a presentence report has not been completed, the department shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(2)(b)(i): make a postsentence report ; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(2)(b)(ii): provide a copy of the postsentence report to the board as soon as possible.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(2)(c): The department shall provide the board, upon request, any additional investigations or information needed by the board to reach a decision or conduct a hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(3): The department shall make the department's facilities available to the board to carry out the board's functions.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(4): Law enforcement officials responsible for the offender's arrest, conviction, and sentence shall furnish all pertinent data requested by the board.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(5)(a): If an indeterminate sentence is imposed in a case, the court shall forward, within 30 days after the day on which the sentence was imposed, to the board:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(5)(a)(i): a record of the judgment and commitment;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(5)(a)(ii): if available and in the court's possession, a victim impact statement referring to any loss suffered by a victim; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(5)(a)(iii): any other record that the court believes will be relevant to the board, including a statement:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(5)(a)(iii)(A): proposing the term for which, in the court's opinion, the offender should be imprisoned;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(5)(a)(iii)(B): any information the court may have regarding the character of the offender; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(5)(a)(iii)(C): any mitigating or aggravating circumstances connected with the offense for which the offender has been convicted.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(5)(b): If the court amends an order for a judgment and commitment, the court shall forward the amended order to the board within 30 days after the day on which the amended order is entered.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(6): If an indeterminate sentence is imposed in a case and the offender is committed to prison, the prosecuting attorney shall forward, in writing and within 30 days after the day on which the sentence was imposed, to the board:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(6)(a): a victim impact statement referring to any loss suffered by a victim; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(6)(b): any other information the prosecuting attorney believes will be relevant to the board, including a summary and recommendations related to the case.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(7): Notwithstanding Subsection (5) or (6), the board may remove from the board's files any:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(7)(a): statement that the board is not going to rely on in the board's decision-making process;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(7)(b): information found to be incorrect by a court, the board, or an administrative agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(7)(c): duplicative materials.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-13(8): The chief executive officer of any penal or correctional institution shall permit offenders to send mail to the board without censorship.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7 Sex offender restrictions.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1): 57-8-3 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(a): 57-8-3 "Condominium project" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(b): "Minor" means an individual who is younger than 18 years old;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(i): "Protected area" means the premises occupied by:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(i)(A): a licensed day care or preschool facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(i)(B): a public swimming pool or a swimming pool maintained, operated, or owned by a homeowners' association, condominium project, or apartment complex;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(i)(C): a public or private primary or secondary school that is not on the grounds of a correctional facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(i)(D): a community park that is open to the public or a park maintained, operated, or owned by a homeowners' association, condominium project, or apartment complex;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(i)(E): a public playground or a playground maintained, operated, or owned by a homeowners' association, condominium project, or apartment complex, including those areas designed to provide minors with space, recreational equipment, or other amenities intended to allow minors to engage in physical activity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(i)(F): except as provided in Subsection (1)(c)(ii), an area that is 1,000 feet or less from the residence of a victim of the sex offender if the sex offender is subject to a victim requested restriction.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(ii): "Protected area" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(ii)(A): the area described in Subsection (1)(c)(i)(F) if the victim is a member of the immediate family of the sex offender and the terms of the sex offender's agreement of probation or parole allow the sex offender to reside in the same residence as the victim;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(ii)(B): a park, playground, or swimming pool located on the property of a residential home;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(ii)(C): a park or swimming pool that prohibits minors at all times from using the park or swimming pool; or
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(c)(ii)(D): a park or swimming pool maintained, operated, or owned by a homeowners' association, condominium project, or apartment complex established for residents 55 years old or older if no minors are present at the park or swimming pool at the time the sex offender is present at the park or swimming pool.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(1)(d): "Sex offender" means an adult or juvenile who is required to register in accordance with Title 77, Chapter 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry, due to a conviction for an offense that is committed against a person younger than 18 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(2): For purposes of Subsection (1)(c)(i)(F), a sex offender is subject to a victim requested restriction if:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(2)(a): the sex offender is on probation or parole for an offense that requires the offender to register in accordance with Title 77, Chapter 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(2)(b): the victim or the victim's parent or guardian advises the Department of Public Safety that the victim elects to restrict the sex offender from the area and authorizes the Department of Public Safety to advise the sex offender of the area where the victim resides; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(2)(c): the Department of Public Safety notifies the sex offender in writing that the sex offender is prohibited from being in the area described in Subsection (1)(c)(i)(F) and provides a description of the location of the protected area to the sex offender.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(3): A sex offender may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(3)(a): be in a protected area except:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(3)(a)(i): when the sex offender must be in a protected area to perform the sex offender's parental responsibilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(3)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(3)(a)(ii)(A): when the protected area is a public or private primary or secondary school; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(3)(a)(ii)(B): the school is open and being used for a public activity other than a school-related function that involves a minor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(3)(a)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(3)(a)(iii)(A): if the protected area is a licensed day care or preschool facility located within a building that is open to the public for purposes other than the operation of the day care or preschool facility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(3)(a)(iii)(B): the sex offender does not enter a part of the building that is occupied by the day care or preschool facility; or
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(3)(b): serve as an athletic coach, manager, or trainer for a sports team of which a minor who is younger than 18 years old is a member.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(4): A sex offender who violates this section is guilty of:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(4)(a): a class A misdemeanor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.7(4)(b): if previously convicted of violating this section within the last ten years, a third degree felony.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8 Sex offender in presence of a child -- Definitions -- Penalties.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(1)(a): "Accompany" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(1)(a)(i): to be in the presence of an individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(1)(a)(ii): to move or travel with that individual from one location to another, whether outdoors, indoors, or in or on any type of vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(1)(b): "Child" means an individual younger than 14 years of age.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(2): 76-5-301.1 A sex offender subject to registration in accordance with Title 77, Chapter 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry, for an offense committed or attempted to be committed against a child younger than 14 years of age is guilty of a class A misdemeanor if the sex offender requests, invites, or solicits a child to accompany the sex offender, under circumstances that do not constitute an attempt to violate Section
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(2)(a)(i): the sex offender, prior to accompanying the child:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(2)(a)(i)(A): verbally advises the child's parent or legal guardian that the sex offender is on the state sex offender registry and is required by state law to obtain written permission in order for the sex offender to accompany the child; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(2)(a)(i)(B): requests that the child's parent or legal guardian provide written authorization for the sex offender to accompany the child, including the specific dates and locations;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(2)(a)(ii): the child's parent or legal guardian has provided to the sex offender written authorization, including the specific dates and locations, for the sex offender to accompany the child; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(2)(a)(iii): the sex offender has possession of the written authorization and is accompanying the child only at the dates and locations specified in the authorization;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(2)(b): the child's parent or guardian has verbally authorized the sex offender to accompany the child either in the child's residence or on property appurtenant to the child's residence, but in no other locations; or
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(2)(c): the child is the natural child of the sex offender, and the offender is not prohibited by any court order, or probation or parole provision, from contact with the child.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(3): 77-41-105; 77-41-107
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(3)(a): 77-41-105 A sex offender convicted of a violation of Subsection (2) is subject to registration in accordance with Title 77, Chapter 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry, for an additional five years subsequent to the required registration under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(3)(b): 77-41-107 The period of additional registration imposed under Subsection (3)(a) is also in addition to any period of registration imposed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(4): It is not a defense to a prosecution under this section that the defendant mistakenly believed the individual to be 14 years of age or older at the time of the offense or was unaware of the individual's true age.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.8(5): This section does not apply if a sex offender is acting to rescue a child who is in an emergency and life-threatening situation.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9 Sex offender assessment.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1): (1)(b); (1)(b) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(a): "Dynamic factors" means a person's individual characteristics, issues, resources, or circumstances that:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(a)(i): can change or be influenced; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(a)(ii): affect the risk of recidivism or the risk of violating conditions of probation or parole.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b): "Multi-domain assessment" means an evaluation process or tool which reports in quantitative and qualitative terms an offender's condition, stability, needs, resources, and dynamic factors affecting the offender's transition into the community and compliance with conditions of probation or parole, such as the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(i): alcohol and other drug use;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(ii): mental health status;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(iii): physical health;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(iv): criminal behavior;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(v): education;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(vi): emotional health and barriers;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(vii): employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(viii): family dynamics;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(ix): housing;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(x): physical health and nutrition;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xi): spirituality;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xii): social support systems;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xiii): special population needs, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xiii)(A): co-existing disorders;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xiii)(B): domestic violence;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xiii)(C): drug of choice;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xiii)(D): gender, ethnic, and cultural considerations;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xiii)(E): other health issues;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xiii)(F): sexual abuse; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xiii)(G): sexual orientation;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xiv): transportation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(b)(xv): treatment involvement.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(c): (1)(b) "Qualitative terms" means written summaries used to describe meaning, enrich, or explain significant quantitative indicators or benchmarks within the areas defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(1)(d): (1)(b) "Quantitative terms" means numerical distinctions or benchmarks used to describe conditions within the areas defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(2): (1)(b) The department shall issue a request for proposals to provide a periodic multi-domain assessment tool, as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(3): The request for proposals shall include a requirement that the multi-domain assessment tool be designed to be administered:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(3)(a): every 16 weeks during the first year a sex offender is supervised in the community; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(3)(b): every 12 to 26 weeks during the second and subsequent years a sex offender is supervised in the community, as determined appropriate by the department's supervisory personnel and the sex offender's treatment team.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(4): The department shall promptly make results of the multi-domain assessment available to:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(4)(a): the sex offender's treatment team; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(4)(b): the corrections personnel responsible for supervising the offender.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(5): The department shall provide to the legislative Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Interim Committee at the conclusion of the trial period a written report of the results of the use of the multi-domain assessments, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(5)(a): the impact on recidivism;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(5)(b): other indicators of the effect of the use of the assessments;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(5)(c): the number of assessments administered annually;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(5)(d): the number of individuals who were assessed during the year; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-21.9(5)(e): any recommended legislative or policy changes.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24 Out-of-state supervision of probationers and parolees -- Compacts.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The governor of this state is authorized to execute a compact on behalf of the State of Utah with any other state legally joining therein.  "State," as used in this section, includes any state, territory or possession of the United States, and the District of Columbia.  The compact shall be in substantially the following form:Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(1): A compact entered into by and among the contracting states, signatories thereto, with the consent of the Congress of the United States of America, granted by an act entitled An Act Granting the Consent of Congress to any two or more States to enter into Agreements or Compacts for cooperative effort and mutual assistance in the prevention of crime and for other purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2): The contracting states solemnly agree:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2)(a): That it shall be competent for the duly constituted judicial and administrative authorities of a state party to this compact (herein called sending state) to permit any person convicted of an offense within such state and placed on probation or released on parole to reside in any other state party to this compact (herein called receiving state) while on probation or parole, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2)(a)(i): such person is in fact a resident of or has his family residing within the receiving state and can obtain employment there; or
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2)(a)(ii): though not a resident of the receiving state and not having his family residing there, the receiving state consents to such person being sent there.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2)(a)(ii)(A): Before granting such permission, opportunity shall be granted to the receiving state to investigate the home and prospective employment of such person.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2)(a)(ii)(B): A resident of the receiving state, within the meaning of this section, is one who has been an actual inhabitant of such state continuously for more than one year prior to his coming to the sending state and has not resided within the sending state more than six continuous months immediately preceding the commission of the offense for which he has been convicted.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2)(b): That each receiving state will assume the duties of visitation of and supervision over probationers or parolees of any sending state and in the exercise of those duties will be governed by the same standards that prevail for its own probationers and parolees.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2)(c): That duly accredited officers of a sending state may at all times enter a receiving state and there apprehend and retake any person on probation or parole from such sending state.  For that purpose no formalities will be required other than establishing the authority of the officer and the identity of the person to be retaken.  All legal requirements to obtain extradition of fugitives from justice are expressly waived on the part of states party hereto as to such persons.  The decision of the sending state to retake a person on probation (or parole) shall be conclusive upon and not reviewable within the receiving state; provided if at the time when a state seeks to retake a probationer or parolee there should be pending against him within the receiving state any criminal charge, or he should be suspected of having committed within such state a criminal offense, he shall not be retaken without the consent of the receiving state until discharged from prosecution or from imprisonment for such offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2)(d): That the duly accredited officers of the sending state will be permitted to transport prisoners being retaken through any and all states parties to this compact without interference.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2)(e): That the governor of each state may designate an officer who, acting jointly with like officers of other contracting states, if and when appointed, shall promulgate such rules and regulations as may be deemed necessary to more effectively carry out the terms of this compact.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2)(f): That this compact shall become operative immediately upon its execution by any state as between it and any other state or states so executing.  When executed it shall have the full force and effect of law within such state, the form of execution to be in accordance with the laws of the executing state.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-24(2)(g): That this compact shall continue in force and remain binding upon each executing state until renounced by it.  That duties and obligations hereunder of a renouncing state shall continue as to parolees or probationers residing therein at the time of withdrawal until retaken or finally discharged by the sending state.  Renunciation of this compact shall be by the same authority which executed it, on sending six months' notice in writing of intention to withdraw from the compact to the other states party thereto.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-25 Amendments to interstate compact -- Transfer of prisoners -- Costs -- Supplementary agreements.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The governor is authorized, on behalf of the state, to execute amendments to the compacts provided for in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-26 Deputization of agents to effect return of parole and probation violators.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-26(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-26(1)(a): The official administrator of the interstate compact for the supervision of parolees and probationers is authorized and empowered to deputize any person to act as an officer and agent of this state in carrying out the return of any person who has violated the terms and conditions of parole or probation as granted by this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-26(1)(b): (1)(a) In any matter relating to the return of a violator described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-26(2): Any deputization of any person pursuant to this section shall be in writing and the deputized agent shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-26(2)(a): carry formal evidence of his deputization; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-26(2)(b): produce the evidence of deputization upon demand.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-26(3): The official administrator of the interstate compact is authorized, subject to the approval of the governor, to enter into contracts with similar officials of any other state or states for the purpose of sharing an equitable portion of the cost of effecting the return of any person who has violated the terms and conditions of parole or probation as granted by this state.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-27 Retaking or reincarceration for parole or probation violations -- Hearing and notice to sending state -- Detention of parolee or probationer.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Where supervision of a parolee or probationer is being administered pursuant to the interstate compact for the supervision of parolees and probationers, the appropriate judicial or administrative authorities in this state shall notify the compact administrator of the sending state whenever, in their view, consideration should be given to retaking or reincarceration for a parole or probation violation. Prior to the giving of any such notification, a hearing shall be held in accordance with this act within a reasonable time, unless such hearing is waived by the parolee or probationer. The appropriate officer or officers of this state shall as soon as practicable, following termination of any hearing, report to the sending state, furnish a copy of the hearing record, and make recommendations regarding the disposition to be made of the parolee or probationer by the sending state. Pending any proceeding pursuant to this section, the appropriate officers of this state may take custody of and detain the parolee or probationer involved for a period not to exceed 15 days prior to the hearing and, if it appears to the hearing officer or officers that retaking or reincarceration is likely to follow, for such reasonable period after the hearing or waiver as may be necessary to arrange for the retaking or reincarceration.

Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-28 Hearing officer.
-----------------------------------------------
Any hearing pursuant to this act shall be heard by the administrator of the interstate compact for the supervision of parolees and probationers, a deputy of the administrator, or any other person authorized pursuant to the laws of this state to hear cases of alleged parole or probation violation, except that no hearing officer shall be the person making the allegation of violation.

Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-29 Rights of parolee or probationer -- Record of proceedings.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-29(1): With respect to any hearing pursuant to the Uniform Act for Out-of-State Supervision, the parolee or probationer shall have the following rights:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-29(1)(a): reasonable notice in writing of the nature and content of the allegations to be made, including notice that its purpose is to determine whether there is probable cause to believe that he has committed a violation that may lead to a revocation of parole or probation;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-29(1)(b): be permitted to advise with any persons whose assistance he reasonably desires, prior to the hearing;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-29(1)(c): to confront and examine any persons who have made allegations against him, unless the hearing officer determines that such confrontation would present a substantial present or subsequent danger of harm to such person or persons; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-29(1)(d): may admit, deny, or explain the violation alleged and may present proof, including affidavits and other evidence, in support of his contentions.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-29(2): A record of the proceedings shall be made and preserved.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-30 Violation by parolee or probationer supervised in another state -- Hearing in other state -- Procedure upon receipt of record from other state.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In any case of alleged parole or probation violation by a person being supervised in another state pursuant to the interstate compact for the supervision of parolees and probationers, any appropriate judicial or administrative officer or agency in another state is authorized to hold a hearing on the alleged violation. Upon receipt of the record of a parole or probation violation hearing held in another state pursuant to a statute substantially similar to this act, the record shall have the same standing and effect as though the proceeding of which it is a record was had before the appropriate officer or officers in this state, and any recommendations contained in or accompanying the record shall be fully considered by the appropriate officer or officers of this state in making disposition of the matter.

Utah Code Annotated § 77-27-31 Short title.
-------------------------------------------
Sections

Utah Code Annotated - Title 77 - Chapter 28 - Western Interstate Corrections Compact
************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28-1 Compact enacted into law -- Text of compact.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Western Interstate Corrections Compact as contained herein is enacted into law and entered into on behalf of this state with any and all other states legally joining therein in a form substantially as follows:

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28-2 Department of Corrections -- Authority to transfer inmates.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Department of Corrections may transfer an inmate (as defined in Article II (d) of the Western Interstate Corrections Compact) to any institution within or without this state if this state has entered into a contract or contracts for the confinement of inmates in said institutions pursuant to Article III of the Western Interstate Corrections Compact.

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28-3 Duties and powers of courts, departments, agencies and officers in enforcing and effecting compact.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The courts, departments, agencies and officers of this state and its subdivisions shall enforce this compact and shall do all things appropriate to the effectuation of its purposes and intent which may be within their respective jurisdictions including but not limited to the making and submission of such reports as are required by the compact.

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28-4 Board of Pardons and Parole -- Authority to hold hearings.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Board of Pardons and Parole is hereby authorized and directed to hold such hearings as may be requested by any other party state pursuant to Article IV (f) of the Western Interstate Corrections Compact.  The board is further authorized to travel to any state who is a party to the compact to which an inmate is sent for confinement, for the purpose of holding any hearing to which an inmate is entitled by the laws of Utah.

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28-5 Governor -- Power to enter into contracts.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
The governor is empowered to enter into such contracts on behalf of this state as may be appropriate to implement the participation of this state in the Western Interstate Corrections Compact pursuant to Article III thereof.

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28a-2 Department of Corrections -- Authority to transfer inmates.

The board is further authorized to travel to any state which is a party to that Compact and to which an inmate is sent for confinement, for the purpose of holding any hearing to which that inmate is entitled by the laws of Utah.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 77 - Chapter 28b - Interjurisdictional Transfer of Prisoners
****************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-1 Definitions.
-------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-1(1): "Assurance" means a special condition concerning the confinement or release of an offender which must be met prior to the release of the offender.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-1(2): "Offender" means a juvenile certified to be tried as an adult or an adult convicted of any criminal offense under Utah law.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-1(3): "Receiving country" means the jurisdiction to which the offender is to be transferred.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-1(4): "Sending state" means the jurisdiction from which the offender is to be transferred.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-2 Director's authority.
----------------------------------------------------
The director of the Department of Corrections may transfer offenders having foreign citizenship status to countries of citizenship under this chapter if a treaty exists between the United States and the foreign country.

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-3 Eligibility criteria for international transfer.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An offender must meet the following criteria before he may be considered for an international transfer:Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-3(1): the offender is a citizen of the receiving country;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-3(2): the offender consents to transfer to his country of citizenship;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-3(3): the offense committed by the offender constitutes a criminal offense under the laws of the receiving state;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-3(4): the offender does not have fewer than 12 months remaining on his sentence at the time of the application for transfer;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-3(5): the offender is not under a sentence of death;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-3(6): the offender does not have collateral attacks or appeals on either the sentence or conviction pending;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-3(7): all other provisions of the imposed sentence such as fines, restitution, and penalties are paid in full;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-3(8): there are no detainers, wanted notices based on criminal convictions, indictments, informations, complaints, or parole or probation violation allegations pending against the offender; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-3(9): the offender meets all of the eligibility requirements of the treaty with his country.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4 Role of the classification officer.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(1): The classification officer of each correctional institution shall be provided with the eligibility requirements of each prisoner transfer treaty.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(2): The classification officer shall forward Form I, Transfer Inquiry, to all offenders identified as having national or citizenship status in a party nation.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(3): Upon receipt of Form I, Transfer Inquiry, the offender may indicate he is:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(3)(a): interested in pursuing a transfer by signing Form I and returning it to the classification officer along with proof of citizenship; or
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(3)(b): not interested in pursuing a transfer by returning Form I to the classification officer without proof of citizenship.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(4): If the offender indicates on Form I, Transfer Inquiry, that he is interested in pursuing a transfer, the institution classification officer shall complete Form II, Inmate Information Provided to Treaty Nation, and Form III, Notice Regarding International Prisoner Transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5): The following forms, provided by the federal government, shall be completed and forwarded in triplicate by the classification officer to the superintendent of the institution:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5)(a): Form I, Transfer Inquiry;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5)(b): Form II, Inmate Information Provided to Treaty Nation;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5)(c): Form III, Notice Regarding International Prisoner Transfer;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5)(d): proof of citizenship;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5)(e): statement of offender's eligibility;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5)(f): presentence report;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5)(g): classification assessment;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5)(h): current psychological and medical reports;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5)(i): signed release of confidential information forms;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5)(j): criminal history sheet; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-4(5)(k): judgments of conviction or certification to be tried as an adult.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-5 Role of institution warden.
----------------------------------------------------------
The warden shall sign Form III, Notice Regarding International Prisoner Transfer, and forward the application and the material required in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6 Role of Inmate Placement Program Bureau.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(1): 77-28b-3 The Department of Corrections Inmate Placement Program Bureau shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(1)(a): investigate the request to ensure that all eligibility requirements are met;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(1)(b): 77-28b-3 request a records check to verify records listed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(1)(c): review application and materials for completeness and compliance with treaty terms;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(1)(d): develop and recommend assurances, where indicated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(1)(e): provide written notification of the transfer request to the following entities and receive objections or other comments for 15 business days after sending the notification:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(1)(e)(i): attorney general;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(1)(e)(ii): prosecuting law enforcement agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(1)(e)(iii): prosecutor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(1)(e)(iv): sentencing court.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(2): If the Inmate Placement Program Bureau investigation determines that the application and materials are incomplete or do not comply with the terms of the treaty, the application shall be rejected and returned to the institution in which the inmate is incarcerated.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-6(3): If the investigation of the bureau determines the application and materials are complete and in compliance with the terms of the treaty, the application and materials shall be forwarded to the director of the Department of Corrections.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-7 Role of director.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-7(1): The director of the Department of Corrections shall review the application and materials.  Upon his approval the application and materials shall be forwarded to the governor for authorization to transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-7(2): Applications that are not approved by the director shall be returned to the sending institution and the inmate shall be notified.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-8 Referral to the United States Department of Justice, Office of International Affairs.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-8(1): Upon receipt of the governor's authorization for international transfer, the application and materials shall be forwarded to the United States Department of Justice, Office of International Affairs, by the Inmate Placement Program Bureau.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-8(2): The bureau shall notify the inmate and the warden of the sending institution of the decision of the application for international transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-8(3): All arrangements regarding the treaty process and proposed assurances shall be negotiated between the bureau and the United States Department of Justice, Office of International Affairs.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-9 Transfer of offender.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-9(1): If the inmate is accepted for international transfer by the United States Department of Justice, Office of International Affairs, the offender shall be transported by the Department of Corrections to the federal district court for a verification hearing to ensure the offender consents to the international transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28b-9(2): The Department of Corrections shall then relinquish jurisdiction over the offender to the United States Department of Justice.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 77 - Chapter 28c - Interstate Compact for Adult Offender Supervision
************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Interstate Compact for Adult Offender Supervision."

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-102 Preamble.
------------------------------------------


Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-103 Compact.
-----------------------------------------
(a)  The compacting states to this Interstate Compact recognize that each state is responsible for the supervision of adult offenders in the community who are authorized pursuant to the by-laws and rules of this compact to travel across state lines both to and from each compacting state in such a manner as to track the location of offenders, transfer supervision authority in an orderly and efficient manner, and when necessary, return offenders to the originating jurisdictions.  The compacting states also recognize that Congress, by enacting the Crime Control Act, 4 U.S.C.  Section 112 (1965), has authorized and encouraged compacts for cooperative efforts and mutual assistance in the prevention of crime.

Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-104 Definitions -- Compact transfer application fee.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-104(1): 77-28c-103 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-104(1)(a): "Department" means the Department of Corrections.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-104(1)(b): 77-28c-103 "Offender" has the same meaning as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-104(2): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-104(2)(a): Offenders desiring a transfer of supervision to another state under the Interstate Compact for Adult Offender Supervision shall apply to the department for transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-104(2)(b): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-104(3): The department shall collect a fee of $50 from each offender applying for transfer of supervision to another state under the Interstate Compact for Adult Offender Supervision.


Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-105 Compact for Adult Offender Supervision Restricted Account.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-105(1): There is created within the General Fund, a restricted account known as the Interstate Compact for Adult Offender Supervision Restricted Account.
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-105(2): 77-28c-104(3) Money in the account shall consist of the compact application fee collected by the department for a transfer of supervision under the provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-105(3): 77-28c-103 Upon appropriation by the Legislature, money in the account shall be used:
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-105(3)(a): to cover costs incurred in the collection of the fee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 77-28c-105(3)(b): 77-28c-103 for the administration of the Interstate Compact for Adult Offender Supervision, including the payment of the annual assessment levied under Subsection

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
